question: 巻く
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>scroll</kanji>. But, you don't "to scroll." What do you do to scrolls, though? You roll them up, making this word "<vocabulary>to roll</vocabulary>."
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: The thing you are rolling up is your <reading>ma</reading> (<ja>ま</ja>). She's going wild again, so you throw her into a blanket and roll her up to hold her down.
